JS bindings: Add browser support
body:
Make JS/WASM bindings for also the browser in addition to Node.js, by building both Node.js and ES modules variants of the bindings. In package.json we make Node.js and module aware bundlers (e.g. Webpack) use the correct variant via the `main` and `module` fields respectively.

To show how to use the bindings in the browser, I added an example that bundles Indy Crypto with the help of Webpack. The example also shows how you need to import the library dynamically for it to work.

title: Fix links and align version in package.json
body: Fix links in wrappers/javascript/package.json to be to the official repository instead of mine, and align version with that of the core library.

title: Add JavaScript/WASM binding
body:
With this PR I'm adding a JavaScript/WASM binding for the BLS part of libindy-crypto. As a part of this work, I had to factor the library itself into two new features: "ffi" and "cl". This was necessary in order to keep non-BLS bits out of the binding (which wouldn't compile to WASM anyway due to the OpenSSL dependency of the CL code).

The binding is generated with the help of [wasm-bindgen](https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-bindgen), which compiles functions in the `wasm::bls` module into a WASM/JavaScript library.

The binding has documentation and tests in wrappers/javascript, including JavaScript API documentation.

Looking forward to receiving your feedback!

title: Upgrade to openssl v0.10
body:
Upgrade the openssl dependency to v0.10. I had to do this as otherwise I couldn't build libindy-crypto on OS X. Before this patch, the build would fail like this:

```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.29.0 (aa3ca1994 2018-09-11)
$ cargo build
   Compiling openssl v0.9.24
error: failed to run custom build command for `openssl v0.9.24`
process didn't exit successfully: `/Users/arve/Projects/indy-crypto/libindy-crypto/target/debug/build/openssl-de72db301f305406/build-script-build` (exit code: 101)
--- stderr
thread 'main' panicked at 'Unable to detect OpenSSL version', /Users/arve/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/openssl-0.9.24/build.rs:16:14
```

title: Openssl0.10.12
body: bumped rust openssl version to 0.10.12 which used openssl 1.1.1 which support ed25519, tls1.3 and has better Android support
